titles.title: Access to Aid Act of 2001

To amend the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to establish a program to identify and mentor college eligible high school students and their parents or legal guardians, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 2/28/2001--Introduced. Access to Aid Act of 2001 - Amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to authorize the Secretary of Education to establish a demonstration program to assist nonprofit organizations working with local school districts to establish programs that identify and mentor college-eligible students and their families.
